Passage B:
After a lot of tests and interviews, you finally got into a good school or got a good job. But there’s a problem: it’s a long way from home. ”Well, I can take the bus or drive,” you might think. But before you decide 31 it’s OK to have such a long commute, it’s best to know 32 . Having a long commute means you’ll get fewer hours of sleep, and that will make you feel 33 easily. You’ll also have less time for friends and family, for example, or for a nice meal.
A long commute not only eats up your time but also 34 . Studies show that people who have a long commute get fat easily and often have neck or back problems. It’s easier for them to have heart problems, too. 35 Studies also find that these people get angry more often, feel less happy with their lives, and do less well at work. Now, does that good school or that good job still sound great to you? commute

chunk_text:
Freeters are people between the age 15 and 34. They don’t have to work or only work part-time after leaving school.
Many freeters live with their parents and don’t have to worry about enough money to buy food, clothes, or their own house.
Among them, some freeters choose not to work after high school or college though there are a few jobs they can find easily.
Some make money by working at convenience stores, supermarkets, restaurants, or other low-paid jobs. With the low income, they find it hard to start a family.

(D) Fank; he is running a coffee shop and his business is pretty good.

chunk_text:
E.
In Taiwan, most junior high school students have to wear uniforms to school. Students want to know why they should do so and why they can’t wear their own clothes to school.
Some students don’t want to wear uniforms because they don’t think uniforms are beautiful. They don’t want to wear the same clothes as others. If they wear their own clothes, they can look special and more beautiful or handsome. However, they will spend more time on clothes than the schoolwork, or they will ask their parents to buy more clothes for them.
Some students think wearing uniforms is great. First, they don’t have to worry about which clothes they should wear to school. Second, their parents don’t need to buy so many clothes for them. Third, others will know they are students when they wear uniforms. Fourth, they think that their uniforms look beautiful and special ,and they are different from other schools’ uniforms.

45. ( ) Why do some students want to wear their own clothes?
(A) They want to look more special and prettier in their own clothes.
(B) They can make clothes by themselves.
(C) Their parents buy too many clothes for them.
(D) They don’t need to buy uniforms.

46. ( ) Which is true if students wear uniforms to school?
(A) Parents have to prepare more beautiful clothes for their children.
(B) Teachers can’t know who their students are.
(C) Students won’t spend too much time choosing the clothes.
(D) They can get higher grades on tests.

47. ( ) What does they means?
(A) Teachers.
(B) Students.
(C) Parents.
(D) Uniforms.

chunk_text:
Picture him ridig a fast motorcycle off a tall cliff and then skydiving through the air. It’s a moment that will certainly make you say, ”Wow!” But what makes it even cooler? Tom Cruise is doing these incredible stunts himself! Picture him standing on a speedy train and jumping off from a great height-all on his own! It’s like watching a real-life superhero right before our eyes. How amazing! Now, it’s not just about looking cool in the movies. When Tom Cruise does these stunts, he’s actually telling us something important: “Don’t be afraid of challenges.” His bravery isn’t just for the movies; it’s a lesson for all of us. He’s saying,” You can face your fears and do amazing things.” So, the next time you feel a little scared, just think of what Tom Cruise is doing for his Mission Impossible Movies, and remember – you can be brave, too!

48. ( ) What does breathtaking most likely mean in this reading? (A) Tiring. (B) Surprising. (C) boring. (D) Interesting.

49. ( ) Where do you most likely find the reading above? magazine (A) In a superhero comic book. (B) In a colorful picture book. (C) In a fashion and lifestyle magazine. (D) In a science and technology magazine.

50. ( ) According to the reading, what does Tom Cruise want to show us through his stunts in Dead Reckoning Part One ? (A) “Bravery is only for the movies.” (B) “ Real heroes can do all the dangerous stunts on their own.” (C) “Acting is all about looking cool.” (D) “ Facing challenges is an important lesson in life.”

chunk_text:
Sharks have long been feared for their really sharp teeth. Although that is enough to keep most people away from those animals, one part of them that has been received with open arms is their fins. The Chinese eat it in the way of a soup, which they say has many things that are good for people’s health. The dish has even grown to become a sign of wealth and class for them.
For many others, shark fin soup is mean and not needed. The reason for that is how the shark fin is taken. It is called shark-finning, and it cuts the fins off living sharks before throwing them back into the ocean. There, they not only lose blood and die, but they also become food for other sea animals. Shark-finning is threatening the sharks and the oceans because the animals grow slowly and some types are already dying off. Millions of these sea animals die every year, which throws everything off balance.
Lucky for us, governments across the planet have taken action to try to fix this problem. In 2000, the USA made shark-finning illegal. Also, Palau, the Maldives, and the Bahamas have set up natural places that are safe for sharks. Thanks to those actions and others, people have become more aware. More people who are getting married don’t have shark fin soup at their weddings. Also, some restaurants have taken the dish off their menus.

29. How do people feel about shark fin soup?
(A) The Chinese think it’s a sign of being rich.
(B) Americans love how the fins are taken.
(C) Everybody knows it’s good for your health.
(D) Nobody wants it to be taken off the menu.
30. What does something being “feared” mean?
(A) It makes people feel nothing.
(B) That thing is really wanted.

chunk_text:
Dear Mavis,
I’m sorry that I didn’t call you as soon as I arrived in New York City as you asked me to. The reason for that is I’ve been busy seeing the sights and having the time of my life. This is the first chance I’ve gotten to sit down and check my e-mails.
Anyway, it’s time that you catch up on what I’ve been up to since I checked in at my hotel on Monday. Yesterday, I got up early because I planned to walk across the Brooklyn Bridge, check out Wall Street, and then visit the 911 Memorial. When I got to the bridge, it was blocked off because a group of people were filming a movie. I moved closer to see if I knew anybody. You’re not going to believe this, but I saw my favorite actor, Tom Hanks, acting there. I tried to take a picture of him, but a guard stopped me before I could. He told me I could stay around and watch as long as I kept quiet and didn’t try that again. Though it was interesting, I decided to leave and finish what I set out to do. The day before that, I spent most of my time exploring Central Park and some of the museums around there. Also, on the first morning, I headed straight for the Empire State Building and then Times Square because I was dying to see them.
There’s too much to share in one e-mail, so I’ll tell you more next time. The city is calling my name, and I must not keep it waiting.
Your friend,
Stephanie

 film  guard  explore  dying to 
32. Why does Stephanie write the letter?
(A) To invite Mavis over.
(B) To share news about her trip.
(C) To let Mavis know how New York City looks.
(D) To answer Mavis’s question.
33. What does “that” refer to?
(A) Talking loudly.
(B) Using a camera.
(C) Taking a step closer.
(D) Shouting someone’s name.

chunk_text:
Ken: Hey, Cindy! Were you affected by the blackout that hit the city yesterday afternoon?
Cindy: Not really because the place that I work at still had power. I had no idea about it until I left the office. I saw that many of the traffic lights were out when I was riding my scooter home.
Ken: You were one of the lucky ones because where I was had no power when it first went out. It lasted for about three hours.
Cindy: That must have been terrible! I read in the paper today that close to seven million people were affected.
Ken: I learned from the news this morning that this was all because someone at the power company made the mistake of turning something important off for a few minutes. By the time they noticed it, six of the machines that make the power already stopped working.
Cindy: Yeah, and I heard that the fire department got over one hundred calls about people who couldn’t get out of elevators. It sounds scary! I had that kind of experience before. I was stuck in the elevator for about one and a half hours, and it was the worst experience I’ve ever had.
Ken: If you think that’s bad, how about the people down in the metro or high up in the air in the cable cars? That would be ten times worse!
Cindy: Well, I’m just glad that all that is over now and that nobody got hurt because of the power cut.

 affect  blackout  traffic light  fire department  elevator 
34. What does “it” mean in the dialogue?
(A) The worker at the power company.
(B) The news about the power cut.
(C) The mistake the worker made.
(D) An important machine that was turned on.
35. What does “stuck” most likely mean?
(A) In a place that is difficult or not possible to get out of.
(B) Something happens suddenly, quickly, and strongly.
(C) Bringing people closer together.
(D) Making people feel nothing.

chunk_text:
Starbucks is not just a place for grown-ups to enjoy coffee; there are also some cool things for kids at Starbucks. Starbucks offers more than just coffee. They have delicious hot chocolate, and even some yummy snacks for kids. You can try a hot chocolate with cream or have a cookie while your parents enjoy their coffee. One fun thing at Starbucks is their colorful mugs. You can buy a colorful mug with your favorite city or country on it. It's like a little souvenir to remind you of your visit to Starbucks. Plus, you can drink your hot chocolate or juice from these cool mugs. Starbucks also cares about the environment. They use recyclable cups and offer reusable ones. This helps protect our planet. You can also bring your own reusable cup to get a discount on your drinks. Starbucks is not just a cafe; it's a good place to relax or do some homework. You can find comfy chairs and free Wi‑Fi in most Starbucks stores. So, whether you want to read a book, do some coloring, or play a game on your tablet, Starbucks is a good choice.

31. What is something besides coffee that you can enjoy at Starbucks?
Options:
(A) Pizza
(B) Tasty cookies
(C) Ice cream
(D) Hamburgers

32. What can you buy at Starbucks to remind you of your visit?
Options:
(A) A colorful mug with a city or country on it
(B) A pet parrot
(C) A magic car
(D) A giant ball

33. How does Starbucks help protect the environment?
Options:
(A) They use disposable cups.
(B) They offer reusable cups.
(C) They waste a lot of water.
(D) They throw garbage in the streets.

34. What can you do at Starbucks if you want to relax or do some homework?
Options:
(A) Find comfy chairs and free Wi‑Fi.
(B) Ride a motorcycle.
(C) Go swimming.
(D) Play baseball.

chunk_text:
The History and Poses of Yoga
Yoga is an old practice that has been around for thousands of years. It is from India and has a rich history. The word "yoga" comes from the Sanskrit language and means to unite or join. Yoga is all about connecting your body and mind through different poses and breathing ways.
One of the most famous books about yoga is the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali, written around 200 BC. Patanjali is the father of yoga.
Yoga has many poses, and each pose has its own benefits. Tree Pose is all about balance, as you stand on one leg with the other foot pressed against your thigh. Child's Pose is a relaxing position where you sit back on your heels, put your arms forward. Yoga poses are like a special exercise that makes your body feel good.

36. Where is yoga from?
Options:
(A) China
(B) India
(C) Japan
(D) Egypt

37. What does the word "yoga" mean in Sanskrit?
Options:
(A) To fly
(B) To
(C) To unite or join
(D) To eat

38. Who is the father of yoga?

39. Which yoga pose helps you relax?
Options:
(A) Warrior Pose
(B) Dog Pose
(C) Tree Pose
(D) Child's Pose

chunk_text:
Buy Buy is a fast fashion clothes company. To keep the prices low but still make money, the company moves the factories to countries like India for cheap workers. Those workers work long hours for very low pay. They can get only 5% of the money when people buy the clothes they made.

The company uses polyester to make clothes because it is cheap. However, the polyester goes into the sea and hurts the environment when people wash the clothes.

Many people buy the clothes from Buy Buy on the Internet because the clothes are beautiful but not expensive.

However, the truth behind those beautiful clothes can be ugly. What can we do for the ugly truth? Let’s think about it.

47. ( ) What can be the title for the reading? (A) Don’t Buy Clothes On the Internet. (B) Cheap Workers Got Very Low Pay. (C) How to Buy Cheap Clothes Online. (D) The Ugly Truth Behind Beautiful Clothes.

48. ( ) What does They in line 4 mean? (A) The factory workers. (B) The factories. (C) The cheap clothes. (D) The countries.

49. ( ) Jane bought a skirt for 300 dollars from Buy Buy. How much money can the workers get? (A) Five dollars. (B) Twenty-five dollars. (C) Fifteen dollars. (D) One hundred dollars.

50. ( ) Which is NOT correct? (A) The clothes are not expensive. (B) The polyester is good to the environment. (C) The workers work for long hours for low pay. (D) Buy Buy company sells clothes on the Internet.

chunk_text:
Hi, Uncle Danny,
How are you doing there? We are junior high school students now. Our school is so cool. There is a beautiful lake.
The boys love to play around the lake, and the girls love to walk and chat around it. We really enjoy our school life here.
Thank you for the English storybooks. We want to read them every day, but we can’t. We have tests, and we can only read your storybooks on weekends. Some words in the books are hard for us, but we really love reading them. We can learn new words from the books. The stories are so great, and we have a lot of thoughts about them. Our favorite story is The Quiet Museum. Do you like it, too?
By the way, do you remember our pet dog, Lucky? He can listen to us and sit down or stand up now. He can catch a ball, too. Isn’t he cool? Please come to see Lucky and us next year. We miss you!
Nick and Tom

10 ( ) What CAN’T Lucky do?
(A) Stand up.
(B) Sit down.
(C) Catch a ball.
(D) Remember stories.

chunk_text:
Many people visit India because of its delicious food. There are some rules for everyone to follow when they eat in India.

First, Indians eat with their right hands. Only use your right hand when you eat. Keep your left hand by your side, and do not put it on the table.

Second, don’t pass food to people with your left hand. This is because Indian people think the right hand is clean and the left hand is dirty.

Third, only touch your own food, and never touch other people’s food. When you touch their food, it becomes dirty in their eyes.

Follow these rules, and you can enjoy Indian food with Indians!

※ pass  holy  manner  left

1. ( ) What is the best title for this reading? (A) Table Manners in India (B) Guides to Interesting India (C) Ways to Be Happy in India (D) Menus of an Indian Restaurant
2.( ) What can you do when you eat in India? (A) (B) (C) (D)
3.( ) Why don’t Indians use their left hands when they eat? (A)Because their left hands are too clean. (B) Because left hands are “dirty hands” for them. (C) Because their left hands are always on the table. (D) Because they don’t know the way to eat with their left hands.
source: ./pdf/市立大樹國中 八年級 112 上學期 語文領域 英文 第一次段考 期中考 康軒 試卷.pdf

chunk_text:
George and Mary were husband and wife, and they were very old. They had memory problems, so they went to see a doctor. “I can’t help you much. You’re losing your memory because of your age. Just write everything down. That can help.” George and Mary thanked the doctor and went home.
Later that night, they were watching TV when George got up from his chair. Mary asked, “Where are you going?”
“​To the kitchen, I’m thirsty.”
Mary thought for a minute and then said, “I’m hungry. Can you make a sandwich for me?”
“​Sure.”
“Write it down. You have memory problems,” said Mary.
“​I can remember it. What else do you want?”
Mary said, “Maybe some ice cream with banana. Write them down, please. You can’t remember them all.”
“I can remember. You want a sandwich and some ice cream with banana.” George said and left for the kitchen. After 20 minutes, he came back. Mary was watching TV when he handed her a bowl of cookies. “​Here you go,” he said.
She looked at the food and said, “See? You couldn’t remember my request. Where is my milk for the cookies?”

9. ( ) A person with memory problem can’t _______________.
(A) write (B) drink milk (C) make good food (D) remember things

10. ( ) Which is true about George and Mary?
(A) George went to the kitchen because he was hungry.
(B) Mary was losing her memory, so she asked George for help.
(C) Mary was right because George couldn’t remember her request.
(D) The doctor couldn’t help them because they didn’t have money.

11. ( ) What is the joke in the story?
(A) Mary wanted a lot of food.
(B) George didn’t remember the milk.
(C) George and Mary couldn’t remember the request.
(D) George didn’t write things down and got the wrong food.

Do you like to eat happy meals at McDonald’s? Have your parents ever told you they are unhealthy?
Most kids in Taiwan have tried happy meals from McDonald’s. Some are crazy about the toys that come with the meals, and some only care about the fast food. No matter what, the toy is one of the tricks that ＿36.＿.
Today, more and more people know how unhealthy fast food is and how the toy is used. To do some changes, McDonald’s in the United States sells happy meals with books now, but not with toys.
It started in November, 2013. McDonald’s used happy meal books to promote literacy. It gave away 17 million books in only two weeks, and it said that all books were McDonald’s originals. Every story was about an animal that is learning how to eat healthily.
＿37.＿ McDonald’s doesn’t want its business to be in danger soon. It hopes the books in happy meals will change people’s minds about McDonald’s. Besides books, McDonald’s has also put vegetable and fruit into their menu, making people have healthier choices.
However, though McDonald’s has done a lot of changes, people argue that ＿38.＿. Even with healthy food in the menu and useful knowledge from the books, fast food still hurts our bodies. That fact has never changed.
So far, we can see that there are many perspectives on this fast food topic. When you see something good, you have to know there must be something bad behind it. You not only need to open your eyes and ears to see and to hear, but also think more, on your own, without any help from McDonald’s. ＿39.＿

chunk_text:
Put Your Time to Good Use with TimeRepublik
With more than 100,000 members in 100 countries, users of TimeRepublik freely exchange their skills for TimeCoins. Each TimeCoin is worth 15 minutes of service people provide. The idea was to create a system where members perform tasks like cooking dinner or teaching guitar in exchange for time credits. For example, a person walking a dog for another person can later use the five TimeCoins they earned to learn French from others. With awards for providing certain amounts of services and the promise of an expanded network, TimeRepublik is a great platform to learn new skills as well as give back to the community.

chunk_text:
Thailand’s Festival of Lights
Water is a valuable resource, and it plays an important role in Thailand’s traditions, beliefs, and daily life.
A festival called Loy Krathong is celebrated in the country every year to honor Thailand’s goddess of water.
The purpose of this holiday is to give thanks to the goddess and also ask for her forgiveness for polluting or wasting the water. There are many theories about the origins of the festival. A common one says that Nang Noppamas, a woman living in the ancient Sukhothai Kingdom in the 13th or 14th century, started the tradition.

chunk_text:
Is AI Friend or Foe?
Many teachers have been experimenting with AI technologies, like ChatGPT, in the classroom. ChatGPT is a chatbot developed by OpenAI. The company’s website became one of the 50 most‑visited in the world this year.
People can ask the chatbot a question, and it will reply with an answer in essay form. Students and teachers are considering the effects of this on schools.
Some school districts have banned ChatGPT. Some teachers see it as a tool that can be used to cheat. However, many educators say it’s too late to keep AI out of their classrooms. Some think ChatGPT is to English and writing what the calculator is to math. Some teachers said ChatGPT helped them come up with creative ideas for classes and to simplify texts for students not fluent in English.
ChatGPT’s answers are not always right. Text generated by ChatGPT often contains factual errors, can be in the wrong format, or the tone can be off. What’s more, it may contain biases from the data it uses. For example, the views, knowledge, and experiences of smaller communities are less represented.
Some say those with access to a high‑speed Internet connection will be able to use AI consistently, but many students do not have that access. So allowing the use of AI for schoolwork could also lead to an unfair situation that will benefit some students over others.

49. What is ChatGPT?
(A) A chatbot.
(B) A smartphone.
(C) A teacher.
(D) A student.

50. Why have some school districts banned ChatGPT?
(A) It makes homework too difficult for students.
(B) Students would spend all their time reading.
(C) Students could use it to cheat.
(D) Teachers don’t know how to use it.

51. Which of the following might be an example of "biases"?
(A) Not all women like to go shopping.
(B) Men and women can do many of the same things.
(C) Not all men like to watch sports.
(D) Men should make more money than women for doing the same work.

chunk_text:
Darayya’s Library
John Edwards, July 21 2016
In Darayya, a city in Syria, there’s a library, and it has 15,000 books on almost every subject. However, it is different from any libraries you know. It is a secret underground library, and only people in Darayya know where it is.
Over the years, war has shaken Darayya badly. Every day, houses are bombed and people are killed.
Stores are closed one after another, and schools are, too. To help the kids in Darayya with their learning, Anas Ahmad, a 19-year‑year-old student, and his friends decided to build a library. They built the library under the ground to keep it safe from bombing. But it is dangerous to collect books for the library. Often, Ahmad and his friends look for books in houses that were bombed. They need to be careful because they may be killed in another bombing.
You may ask, “In a place like Darayya, would people be interested in books?” “Just like the body needs food, the mind needs books,” says one library user. In the library, people enjoy their time of reading and forget about the terrible world above. Through reading, they are able to dream of a better life after war.

( )19. Below are the ideas that are talked about in the reading.
a. The problems Darayya has.
b. How Darayya’s library was started.
c. What makes Darayya’s library special.
d. How Darayya’s library helps people there.
In what order does the writer put his ideas in the reading?
(A) c → b → a → d (B) b → a → d → c. (C) a → c → b → d. (D) c → a → b → d.

( )20. Why do people in Darayya go to the library even during the war?
(A) They can get free food.
(B) They find joy and hope in reading.
(C) They want to learn how to win the war.
(D) Their school teachers give lessons there.

( )21. Which is true about Darayya’s library?
(A) It was built during the war.
(B) It has been bombed many times.
(C) It was built to remember people who died in the war.
(D) Most of its books are collected from outside of Darayya.
source: ./pdf/市立大樹國中 九年級 112 上學期 語文領域 英文 第二次段考 期中考 南一 試卷.pdf

chunk_text:
BE THE REAL KING OF OLYMPUS DEITIES
The key to the greatest power appears.
No deity will let the chance go by.
Want to be one of them?
Choose the role and let your fight ROCK.

Zeus
He is the king of the sky. The thunderbolt is his deadly weapon. His power is greater than all the other deities, but he must hide from his wife, Hera, when she is angry, or he will lose all his power for ten minutes.

Hera
The wife of Zeus, deity of married women, doesn't have any deadly weapon, but when a married woman comes to her for help, her attack becomes deadly while the married woman is around.

Poseidon
He is the king of the sea and one of Zeus' brothers. Everything in front of him breaks when he shakes his trident. Giving him a horse can stop his attack.

Hades
He’s also one of Zeus' brothers. He rules over the dead, so all his power comes from them. The more dead people come to him, the more power he has. However, he doesn't kill or attack anyone when his beautiful wife, Persephone, is with him.

( )24. What is Poseidon's trident?
(A) Poseidon's lovely wife. (B) One of Poseidon's pets.
(C) A kind of weapon in the game. (D) A friendly deity in the game.

chunk_text:
Big cats are beautiful wild animals. Let’s find out something interesting about them. The cheetah has long legs and a long tail. It is called the fastest land animal.
Long legs and tails help cheetahs run quickly. The tiger is the biggest of all the big cats. It is much bigger than the cheetah. Leopards are the smallest of the big cats. They are good at climbing. The leopard may look small, but it has lots of power. Jaguars come from America. They have cool spots and have the strongest bite of all the big cats. They are known to eat more than 85 species of prey, including deer, squirrels, birds, and even snails. A lion lives with its family and has no fear of other animals. Female lions give birth to baby lions. What’s more, mother lions do most of the hunting. They hunt for as a group and bring food back for the pride, their family. As for male lions, they sleep a lot to save energy and keep cool. Male lions protect the pride. Therefore, people say that a lion is the king of the jungle. These facts about the big cats are amazing, aren’t they?

Which big cat is a social animal?
(A) A tiger.
(B) A cheetah.
(C) A lion.
(D) A leopard.

What can a jaguar do?
(A) It can run the fastest.
(B) It can climb trees.
(C) It can take care of big cats.
(D) It can eat different kinds of animal bodies because of its strong bite.

Which is true?
(A) Male lions are good at hunting food for baby lions.
(B) Tigers are larger than leopards and cheetahs.
(C) Cheetahs have cool spots and live in America.
(D) Leopards have long legs and long tails.
source: ./pdf/縣立溪湖國中 九年級 112 上學期 語文領域 英文 第二次段考 期中考 康軒 試卷.pdf

chunk_text:
Ms. Sullivan also kept teaching Helen words. She wrote words with her fingers () on Helen’s hand, but Helen never really knew the meaning. One day, when Helen put her hand under the water, Ms. Sullivan wrote the word “water” on Helen’s other hand over and over (). Helen finally learned the meaning of the word. She was so happy and couldn’t wait to learn more about the world around her. Helen Keller said, “Thanks to Ms. Sullivan. She gave me a new life.”

1. How was Helen doing before she met Anne Sullivan?
(A) She was living a terrible and unhappy life.
(B) She almost died from hunger.
(C) She couldn’t write because she broke her arms.
(D) She enjoyed learning the world around her.

2. How did Anne Sullivan teach Helen words?
(A) She wrote words on a piece of paper.
(B) She read words over and over to Helen.
(C) She wrote words on Helen’s hand.
(D) She played different word games with Helen.

3. What is the correct order?
a. Helen fought with Anne Sullivan.
b. Helen learned more about the world around her.
c. Anne Sullivan wrote words on Helen’s hand.
d. Anne Sullivan started to teach Helen manners.
(A) a → b → c → d.
(B) c → d → a → b.
(C) b → d → c → a.
(D) d → a → c → b.

chunk_text:
There is a woman from Pakistan, and her name is Malala Yousafzai. When she was a child, she always loved her school and classes. At that same time, there was a group of people, the Taliban. They didn’t care about women’s education.
“Woman should be cooking at home and having babies. They shouldn’t go to school.” The Taliban said. They then stopped women from going to school ever again.
Malala didn’t like this, so she did something about it. She wrote her story and spoke it out for the world. The Taliban was very angry, so they shot her. She was almost dead. Two years later, she won the Nobel Peace Prize. What an amazing woman!

( ) 14. What do we know about Malala?
    (A) The Taliban shot Malala’s family.
    (B) She didn’t care about Women.
    (C) She liked her school life very much.
    (D) She joined the Taliban at school.
( ) 15. What does this meaning in the reading?
    (A) Women shouldn’t cook at home.
    (B) Women shouldn’t look after babies.
    (C) Women shouldn’t go to school.
    (D) Women shouldn’t join Taliban.
( ) 16. What may be the saying() from Malala?
    (A) There is no place like home.
    (B) When they go low, we go high.
    (C) It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy our life.
    (D) One child, one teacher, one book, one pen can change the world.

The Way Out
by Ming-da Wang
Words from readers
Sam Lee
I couldn’t put the book down after I read it at my friend’s home. I borrowed it and read it over that night. I think it can help someone who is scared of facing family problems.
Candy Vigor
The book saved my life. It opened a door that led me into a world of true love. I can look at the world around me with new eyes.
Rod Green
The first part of the book really touched my heart and made me want to read on. However, I was getting bored when I came to the second part. In fact, I didn’t finish the book.
Vivian Lu
The book helped me forget about my worries. With its easy words, people of all ages can enjoy it.

chunk_text:
Cinco de Mayo
Cinco de Mayo means “May 5th” and is a celebration of Mexican culture. People celebrate it every year in Mexico and some parts of America.
The people of Mexico celebrate Cinco de Mayo with food, music, and dancing. Girls wear beautiful and colorful dresses. They also put flowers in their hair. Boys wear a sombrero, or Mexican hat.
In America, many schools teach children about Mexican culture. Children decorate Mexican flags and learn some Mexican songs and dances. They dance together, have fun, and learn about Mexico. Learning about other cultures is a fun experience for all.
 celebration  Mexico  Mexican ()/ culture  flag

20. What is the reading mainly about?
(A) The music and food culture in the U.S.A.
(B) The flags, songs and dances in Mexico
(C) The celebration of Cinco de Mayo in Mexico and parts of the USA.
(D) The difference between Mexican and American culture.

21. What is NOT true?
(A) Mexicans celebrate Cinco de Mayo with joy.
(B) Mexicans celebrate Cinco de Mayo in autumn.
(C) Many American children can learn Mexican culture at school.
(D) Mexican boys celebrate Cinco de Mayo in a Mexican hat.

Vivian I love taking pictures ＿31.＿ show the world in its natural beauty. From January 1st, I’m going to take the camera with me at all times and take ＿32.＿ one picture each day.
Jemal If I don’t lose a few pounds soon, I won’t be able to find anything that I can wear. ＿33.＿ Just walking to my car is tiring, so I’m going to exercise more from day one.
Denise If something isn’t done soon, our world isn’t going to be around for long. For my part, I’m going to travel in a way ＿34.＿. I’m also going to stop using things which are bad for our earth, too.

chunk_text:
The World's First Phone-Free Island
Ulko‑Tammio is located in the Eastern Gulf of Finland National Park. It is the world's first phone free island. The island offers visitors an escape to the beauty of nature. The officials encourage visitors to enjoy an off‑the‑grid lifestyle by switching off their smart phone. People will not be glued to their phones all the time. They can focus their senses on nature while visiting the island.
Spending time outside in nature can change our mood. It also improves well‑being and lowers anxiety and depression as people feel more connected to the world. The MeriSet company provides boat and sea cruises to get to Ulko‑Tammio.
No one lives on the island, but there are tents or cabins available for overnight camping.
*offer(v) *escape (n.)  *official (n.)  *encourage(v) *lifestyle (n.)  *focus(v) *switch off (phr.) *anxiety(n) *depression(n) *cruise(n) *cabin(n) available(a.)

(C) Ulko‑Tammio is the first Phone‑Free island.
(D) Many people live on the island.

chunk_text:
We’ve all been there: you start scrolling on TikTok during a quick study break, and suddenly, an hour vanishes.
Welcome to the “TikTok Brain” phenomenon. Although it’s not an official medical term, this expression is used to explain how TikTok captures our attention and influences behavior, particularly among young people. Research suggests that excessive TikTok use can disrupt your ability to concentrate on tasks requiring extended attention. This is particularly harmful for children and teens, whose brains are still developing the ability to sustain prolonged focus.
Aside from TikTok, platforms like YouTube and Instagram are also adopting the addictive features of short video applications to attract young viewers. To address this issue, some social media companies are initiating measures to help younger users manage their time more effectively. TikTok, for example, sends reminders to users to take a break, stretch or go for a walk. While social media can be entertaining, don’t let it dominate your brain. Stay aware, establish boundaries, and you can strike a balance between digital enjoyment and real‑world responsibilities.
*scroll (v) *vanish (v) *capture (v) *excessive (a) *disrupt (v) *extended (a) *sustain (v) *prolonged *platform (n) *initiate (v) *preference (n)

44. According to the reading, what is the best topic?
(A) The Best AI.
(B) AI school.
(C) Let “TikTok” dominate your brain.
(D) How “TikTok Brain” Affects you.

grammar_points: 可數名詞與不可數名詞
chunk_text:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) can sometimes seem overpower, but there's no need to be afraid of it. In fact, AI can improve our lives in many ways. Many people may worry that AI will take over their jobs or make them obsolete. However, AI is actually more of a tool that can assist us with lots of things.
One of the biggest things of AI is its ability to analyze large amounts of data and make predictions based on that data. This can be useful in fields such as healthcare, finance, and transportation. For example, AI can help doctors make more correct diagnoses by analyzing medical records and symptoms.
AI can also help us in our day-to-day lives. Virtual assistants like Siri, Alexa, and Google Assistant use AI to understand and respond to our orders. This makes things such as setting reminders, playing music, and searching for information much easier.
Of course, there are also concerns about the wrong use of AI. Deepfake videos, for example, use AI to make videos in a way that makes them look real-life, but they can also be used to spread wrong information or create fake news. It is important for us to be careful and this could be dangerous.
Therefore, AI is not something to be afraid of. It is a powerful tool that can simplify our lives and help us solve difficult problems. However, we must also be responsible users and be aware of the risks. With the right precautions, AI has the potential to make our world a better place.

47. What is the best topic of the article? (A) AI is a tool that can assist us in various tasks. (B) AI can analyze large amounts of data and make predictions. (C) Don’t be afraid of AI. (D) AI can be used to spread misinformation or create fake news.
48. According to the article, what are some things that can benefit from AI? (A) Agriculture and education. (B) Healthcare, finance, and transportation. (C) Hospitality and entertainment. (D) None of the above.
49. What does the article say about virtual assistants like Siri and Alexa? (A) They can help doctors make accurate diagnoses. (B) They can assist in detecting all activities. (C) They use AI to understand and respond to our orders. (D) They do nothing.
50. What is the conclusion the article draws about AI? (A) AI is a powerful tool that can simplify our lives and help us solve complex problems. (B) AI is not a useful tool. (C) AI is something to be afraid of. (D) AI is a potential danger and we shouldn’t use it.

Guinea Pigs
Many people keep guinea pigs as pets. These small animals are cute, friendly and easy to take care of. Guinea pigs spend a lot of time eating. They need to keep eating things, like fruit, vegetables, and even clothes, or their teeth will become too big for their mouths. Guinea pigs usually live together in big families of 10 or more. It’s better for their health.
Besides, guinea pigs are also a kind of food in South America. They need very little room to grow, so they are a better choice than cows or pigs. For some people, guinea pig meat is delicious and tastes like chicken or rabbit meat. In some countries, people even give each other guinea pigs as gifts of food. What’s more, people use guinea pigs in animal testing. Human test medicines on them.

( ) 15. Below are the writer’s points in the reading. In what order does the writer talk about his points?
a. People test medicines on guinea pigs.
b. Guinea pigs a good choice of food in South America
c. Guinea pigs eat a lot and live with a big family.
(A) a→b→c (B) b→a→c (C) c→b→a (D) c→a→b

chunk_text:
When we go to the beach, sometimes we will see hermit crabs on the beach. And we all know hermit crabs have to change to bigger shells when they grow bigger. In fact, when they finally find a new shell, they have a special habit. They will tell other crabs to change shells together.
How do they change shells together? When they start to get together, they will stand in line according to their body sizes. After the first one (also the biggest one) takes off its shells, the second one (smaller than the biggest one) puts on the shell of the first one. Then the third one puts on the shells of the second one.
Why do they change shells this way? In fact, it is not easy to find a new shell. By doing this, the chance of not finding a shell will be smaller. Hermit crabs try their best to live. To help them, please don’t take away shells on the beach, and don’t leave trash on the beach.
 hermit crab; stand in line; take off ; shell ; according to ; chance

( ) 18. Which does one mean in the reading?
(A) Shell. (B) Trash. (C) beach (D) Hermit crabs

(A) The Life Story of Hermit Crabs
(B) A Fun Facts About Hermit Crabs
(C) Some Good Ideas About Using Shells
(D) How Is Trash Bad to Hermit Crabs

( ) 20. How do the hermit crabs stand in line and change their shells?
(A) → →
(B) → →
(C) → →
(D) → →

( ) 21. What can we NOT know from the reading?
(A) Hermit crabs look for new shells on the beach.
(B) The smallest hermit crabs will be at the end of the line.
(C) It is a good idea to give hermit crabs smaller shells.
(D) If hermit crabs can’t find new shells, they may take trash as their homes.

chunk_text:
If you visit Spain, you will hear people speaking Spanish most of the time. But if you go north to the Basque Country, you will also hear a language that is only spoken there: Euskara. Nobody knows when people began to speak Euskara, but one thing is for sure: It was already in Europe before any other language arrived. Having a sense of humor is something most people think of as being uniquely human. It is so important to us that we can already understand it when we’re just babies. Humor makes us laugh, and laughing helps build relationships and brings people together. Although Euskara has been around for thousands of years, it experienced its worst time in the 1990s, when it almost died out. A sense of humor can bring joy, help us be smarter, healthier, and deal with difficult problems. It can also help us think outside the box. It can teach us not to take things so seriously. It can also teach everyone not to laugh at ourselves. People who laugh a lot are not sad or sick very often, neither are those who laugh with them. When the mind is healthy, so is the body. Children who have a sense of humor seem happier. Those who can appreciate and share humor are also more sociable and usually have more friends. But most of all, humor can make life really fun. There’s nothing quite like laughing so hard that your stomach hurts or until tears are running down your face. A sense of humor is not something we’re born with, though. It is something that we learn and grows with us. It also changes when we get older, much like we do. Things that we find funny as kids become too childish to make us laugh when we’re grown up. Babies, for example, don’t really understand humor yet. They just laugh when something we do is funny to them. As children get older, they turn to physical humor and doing funny things either to make themselves or others laugh. From 1939 to 1975, when Spain was in Francisco Franco’s hands, and everyone had to use Spanish only. Under this rule, people who were heard speaking other languages would be stopped by the police. And the police were always around, so the Basque people were afraid to speak Euskara in any public places. They felt that even the walls were listening. Over time, the Basque people spoke Euskara less and less, and some families even stopped teaching their children the language. To save Euskara, some people set up language schools to teach Euskara. Because of their hard work, Euskara was not “killed” but lived on long after Franco died. Although Euskara is heard and seen across the Basque Country today, Spanish is still more commonly used in Spain. However, many people who know Euskara still choose to speak Spanish in public places. For this reason, some people have started to worry about the future of Euskara. How long can it live?

39. ( ) According to the chart, most people agree that it is not a _______.
(A) in the street.
(B) at a restaurant.
(C) in a meeting.
(D) at the movie theater.

40. ( ) According to the chart, which is correct?
(A) For most people, talking on the phone when having dinner with family is OK.
(B) Nearly half of people would answer their phones when they are on the bus.
(C) Most people are not comfortable with talking on the phones at church.
(D) Nearly half of people wouldn’t use their phones when waiting in line.

41. ( ) Why did the Basque people feel that even the walls were listening?
(A) Because the police would stop people when they spoke Spanish.
(B) Because Euskara could be heard everywhere.
(C) Because the language schools taught students listening skills.
(D) Because they were scared of being heard speaking Euskara.

42. ( ) What problem does the writer think Euskara has today?
(A) There are no language schools teaching Euskara.
(B) Euskara isn’t going to live on under Franco’s rule.
(C) Some families have stopped teaching their children Euskara.
(D) Many Euskara speakers choose to speak Spanish in public places.

43. ( ) Which is true about Euskara?
(A) It is a new language in Europe.
(B) Over time, the Basque people spoke Euskera more and more.
(C) It almost died out in the 1990s.
(D) No one speaks the Basque now.

chunk_text:
School Bullying
Bullying is now a very serious problem in school. More and more students experience bullying in school. Those students may be afraid of going to school. Some of them will not have hope anymore and even kill themselves.
Bullying is when someone makes you feel bad or hurts you again and again.
Many kids think of bullying as hitting or pushing, but it is more than that. Calling people mean names, laughing at people, speaking something bad about people, taking someone’s things without permission, and not letting someone play in a group are also bullying. Now we even have cyberbullying, and it happens online. Bullying can happen at any age, anywhere, and anytime. It can happen for different reasons. Some students bully others just because they want to get more attention. Some of them feel powerful or popular by bullying others.
If someone is mean to you, ignore him or her and show that you don’t care about it at all. When the bullies see that you don’t care about it, they may feel bored and then stop bullying. If you really don’t know how to do it, you can talk to your parents or teachers. They may help you.
If you are a teacher or a parent and students come to tell you that someone bullies them, please make them feel safe and listen to them without judgement. Try to help them as much as you can. We all have a job to stop bullying.
bully  permission  reason ignore
judgment

(A) Family (B) Internet (C) School (D) Neighborhood

TNN News August 10th, 2023
Do you remember the serious drought two years ago? There were no typhoons in 2020, so there was little rain in 2021. Taiwan 35. its worst drought in 67 years then. The water level in lakes and reservoirs on the island were low. Take Sun Moon Lake for example. Its water level dropped from 748.8 m to 737.69 m. Some lakes almost bottomed out. For example, the Zengwen Reservoir was only at 11.5% and the Techi Reservoir is at 5.5$ capacity. The drought went on for a while and there wouldn’t be enough water for people, animals, or plants.
To end a drought, there should be enough rain. But, short rain wouldn’t help much. Only a lot of rain over a long time could stop the drought. 36. , people used water wisely and saved water in many ways.
For example, some parts of Taichung, Miaoli, Hsinchu, and Changhua 37. to take turns to get water on April 6th, 2021. It meant that people living or working in those places have to go without running water for two days a week. Wasn’t it convenient? People now don’t want to experience that again, so they keep saving water in their daily lives. Here are some ways to save water. First, turn off the tap when brushing teeth. Second, take short showers instead of taking the bath. 38. , water plants or your garden from washing fruit and vegetables. Fourth, put a bottle of water in your toilet tank. To get more ways to save water, go to https://www.wwf.org.uk/what-can-i-do/top-ten-water-saving-tips.

(42-44)
Patty: Joshua, I heard that you came back from Canada this summer vacation. I know both Americans and Canadians speak English. However, there are some differences between American English and Canadian English in daily usages. Could you share them with me a little bit?
Joshua: Sure! There are some interesting differences between the two. Let's start with the spelling. People in Canada spell "colour" with a "u" and "centre." They don’t spell "color" and "center." Canadians often follow British English rules when it comes to spelling.
Patty: Ah, I see. It's not common in Taiwan but it’s interesting. And what about words for everyday things? Do you have any special Canadian terms?
Joshua: Yes, for example, Canadians say "washroom" when Americans say "restroom" or "bathroom,” and they say “biscuits” when we say “cookies.” When we ordered a popular sandwich with fries and gravy, Canadians call it "poutine."
Patty: Poutine! I know that. Americans just call it "fries with gravy," but "poutine" sounds fun.
Joshua: It's a delicious treat, for sure. Last, Canadians are known for their politeness, so you might hear they say "sorry" very often, even when it's not necessary. I once saw a closed store and there was a sign outside by the door. It said, “I’m sorry. We don’t open.”
Patty: Oh, it’s a lot of fun. I've heard about that Canadian politeness. Americans say "sorry" too, but not so often.
Joshua: Well, Patty, I hope this chat helps you get more ideas about the differences between American and Canadian English.
 however  difference  common  gravy  politeness  necessary

chunk_text:
Before we talk about CPR, we need to learn about “cardiac arrest.” When people experience cardiac arrest, their hearts stop. After that, their brain cells start to die. To save theirs lives, giving CPR is the first thing to do. However, not many people can do CPR. This causes a high death rate from cardiac arrest. In the USA, about 320,000 people die from cardiac arrest out of the hospital each year, and 70% of them happen at home. Cardiac arrest can happen to people around us at any time. When we put all the facts together, it is easy to see one thing : Everyone needs to learn to do CPR, even children.
We don’t need to be an expert to give CPR, but we do need some education. It is easy to find CPR classes at schools, in hospitals, or even at fire stations, so signing up for one is not difficult at all. When we see people experiencing cardiac arrest, it’s everyone’s job to help them. Their lives are in our hands.

1. ( ) What is the writer’s main purpose?
(A) To ask more people to learn CPR. (B) To teach people about cardiac arrest. (C) To ask people to give more CPR classes. (D) To talk about the death rate from cardiac arrest.
2. ( ) According to the reading, how many people in the USA die at home from cardiac arrest each year?
(A) About 220,500 people. (B) About 224,000 people. (C) About 300,000 people. (D) About 320,000 people.

chunk_text:
Murphy’s Law
Picture it’s breakfast time. You are going to take a bite of nice, warm piece of toast. Then you drop it and it falls, you pray for it to land on the side without butter on. However it lands butter-side down! This is a perfect example of Murphy’s Law.
Did you notice that it always rains when you least expect it? Or when you stand in line at a checkout, why does the line next to yours always seem to move faster? And why does your teacher call on you when you don’t know the answer to a question? If it is possible for something to wrong, it will go wrong—this is Murphy’s Law.
The lesson behind Murphy’s Law is to be prepared for the worst. So, if you aren’t ready for tomorrow’s test, don’t even think about cheating because you will get caught. Study hard.

4. ( ) Which is NOT an example() of Murphy’s Law?
(A) When you forget your wallet, someone pays for you.
(B) You just finished washing your car, and it starts to rain.
(C) The school bus always comes late when you have a test on that day.
(D) You need to talk to someone right away, but they aren’t answering the phone.

5. ( ) Which of the following is NOT the lesson from Murphy’s Law?
(A) Always have more than one plan ready.
(B) Hope for the best, prepare for the worst.
(C) Everything will go wrong, so we don’t need to try hard.
(D) Anything can happen, so we always need to be prepared.
source: ./pdf/市立大樹國中 八年級 112 下學期 語文領域 英文 第一次段考 期中考 翰林 試卷.pdf

chunk_text:
Fake Eyes Protect Cows
Imagine that you are a farmer and keep hundreds of cows. However, large predators like lions come and eat your cows. What will you do to solve this problem? Many people would hunt those lions. This is what farmers in the Okavango Delta in Botswana used to do. They shot the lions with guns, but the problem did not go away. For many years, cows died because of lions, and lions died because of people. The number of lions in Africa has dropped from more than 100,000 in the 1900s to lower than 30,000 in 2020.

Luckily, an Australian biologist named Neil Jordan from the University of New South Wales came up with a smart idea to save both cows and lions. It is to paint eyes on cows butts. In his four-year-study, he followed over 2,000 cows at 14 different farms in the Okavango area. There were 683 with eye-painted butts, but 543 with “X” painted on their butts, and 835 unpainted. The study showed that no cows from the butt-painted group were killed by lions. Jordan was not surprised. He knew before this study that lions usually give up their hunt if they think they’ve been spotted. Now, farmers in Botswana may not need to shoot lions ever again. Sometimes the best way to solve a problem is not to “kill” it but to understand it and “live” with it peacefully.

6. ( ) How many cows with fake eyes painted on their butts were killed() by lions in Jordan’s four-year-study?
(A) 0. (B) 14. (C) 683. (D) More than 2,000.

7. ( ) What is “the problem” mentioned() in the first paragraph()?
(A) People keep too many cows. (B) Lions killed the cows.
(C) People killed lions. (D) The number of lions is dropping.

chunk_text:
In 1971, a group of teenagers in Canada started a 36-hour famine－no food during the 36 hours－to get money or food to help the people in Ethiopia in Africa. Today, a large number of people from all over the world have experienced this activity. Not all the famines are the same in every country. New Zealand, Australia, and South Africa hold a 40-hour famine; Taiwan, the United States and Canada hold a 30-hour famine; the UK and South Korea hold a 24-hour famine; the Philippines holds a 12-hour famine, and Hong Kong holds an 8-hour famine for old people. In 2006, the 17th year of the 30-hour famine in Taiwan, World Vision Taiwan held the DIY Famine. From then on, you can invite a group of more than 10 of your friends, classmates, family members, or co‑workers, pick a time and a place, and start planning your very own DIY famine. If you are not able to join a group, you are also welcome to hold a DIY famine at home. But please note: ◎Anyone younger than 18 must ask their parents first. ◎During the famine, make sure to have enough water or juice. ◎Pregnant women or patients, please do not join the famine. ◎After finishing the famine, start with a light meal. ◎Children under twelve years old are not good for the famine. They can give up on snacks for a day.

1. How long has the 30-hour famine been in Taiwan?
(A) Since 1971. (B) Since 2006. (C) For seventeen years. (D) For over twenty-five years.

2. Which is NOT true about the 30-hour famine in the world?
(A) People do not eat during the famine. (B) Taiwan holds a 30-hour famine, and Canada does, too.
(C) Old people in Hong Kong can join an 8-hour famine. (D) It first started in Ethiopia, Africa.

3. Who can join a DIY famine at home?
(A) Jeff; he’s a junior high school student and can join it if he wants to. (B) Rob; he’s a healthy mail carrier.
(C) Leo; he’s an eight-year-old elementary school student. (D) Max; he has been sick in the hospital for weeks.

4. Which is true about the 30-hour famine?
(A) Only a few people around the world have experienced the activity.
(B) All the famines are the same in each country.
(C) If one is not able to join a group to experience the famine, he or she is also welcome to hold a DIY famine at home.
(D) A group of teenagers in Canada started a 30-hour famine to get money or food for the people in Africa.

chunk_text:
Fake news is something that is not true. It is usually shown as real news on the Internet and used to hurt the reputation of a person or a country. Though fake news has existed for thousands of years, it is still difficult for most modern people to tell whether news is fake or not. For example, when some countries were fighting the pandemic, a lot of fake news said there was not enough rice on the market because farmers in some rice-growing countries could only stay home all day long. Some totalitarian countries sent the fake news with several pictures to worry people who live in free countries and made them not believe in their own countries. Free countries made it clear that it was fake news right away, but it was still not useful because millions of people read it on the Internet. Many countries try to catch those who make fake news, but the best way to fight fake news is to teach people to spot fake news. First, we have to check the writer and the date. Check if the writer is real, and remember old news is not always relevant to what you see now. Second, don’t let your bias make you believe the fake news, which means you need to think twice after reading any stories on the Internet. Third, ask people who have knowledge about what you are not sure of. Taking these actions may not make fake news die, but more people will be able to fight fake news successfully.

41. Which of the following words has the opposite meaning of “totalitarian”?
(A) Enough. (B) Useful. (C) Successful. (D) Free.

42. From the reading, which of the following is NOT a useful way to fight fake news?
(A) Telling people not to believe it. (B) Asking people who understand it.
(C) Checking the date and writer carefully. (D) Thinking twice after listening to the stories.

43. Which of the following is NOT true about fake news?
(A) It worried a lot of people when we were fighting the pandemic.
(B) It didn’t appear in history until modern times.
(C) Catching those who send fake news will not make fake news die.
(D) Teaching people to spot fake news helps people fight fake news.

44. Who might care if the news is fake or not?
(A) Henry : The headline on the news is so surprising that I will share it with all my friends. They should know it right now, too.
(B) Sam : The story on the website is very touching. I have no idea who wrote it, but that’s OK.
(C) Jason : I am not sure whether the report about new medicine is true. My uncle is a doctor. Maybe I can ask him.
(D) Peter : The angles of the news are the same as mine. I totally agree with it and I think it is the trusted report.
source: ./pdf/市立大灣國中 九年級 112 下學期 語文領域 英文 第一次段考 期中考 康軒 試卷.pdf

chunk_text:
Level 2 Psychological richness: Psychological richness is different from other kinds of happiness because it means living a life of variety. You can ask yourself: Have you come across new people, places, and ideas lately?
Level 3 Sense of belonging: It is difficult for anyone to be happy when they feel like they’re not welcome. If you feel like you don’t belong, either at work or at home, you might try to meet people with the same interests.
Level 4 Hedonic happiness: We all need some time to let ourselves enjoy how sweet life is. Find the little things that bring you joy, and try to do more of them.

45. According to the reading, which is NOT a way to feel happy?
(A) Spending time helping people.
(B) Staying in the same place for a long time.
(C) Meeting people who like the same things as you.
(D) Letting yourself enjoy your sweet life.

46. Which of the following is closest in meaning to “variety” in level 2?
(A) Change.
(B) Health.
(C) Chance.
(D) Hobby.

47. What does “them” mean in the last sentence?
(A) Different ways to feel happy.
(B) New people, places, and ideas.
(C) People with similar interests.
(D) Little things that bring joy

chunk_text:
Aaron, the boss of St. Louse Steak House, is reading the customer reviews online. He has to pick a few good ones to post on the Internet. Here is what they said about the steak house:
Customer 1: I love this place. Their drink is wonderful. I come here once a month after work. I always order their honey steak with fries. Their sauce is my favorite.
Customer 2: This place is pretty good for lunch with friends and family. I like their chicken pie with green beans. But it’s too noisy at dinner time during the soccer season. People like to drink and cheer loudly. I like to eat at a quieter place, so I wouldn’t come here for an anniversary.
Customer 3: Last Saturday was my first time here for my cousin’s birthday party. It’s a wonderful place with good food and cool people. I ordered their famous steak. It was delicious. However, there was one thing I didn’t like: The waiter wasn’t polite to my kids when they made some noise. I hope he could talk in a nicer way to young kids.
Customer 4: The restaurant where we planned to go was full of people, so we left. Then we came into this one and were right away served with some warm bread. We were really surprised by that. All drinks are only $5 each during happy hour. The Pink Lady I drank was great. My friend got their most popular drink, Lemon Drop, and she loved it!

48. From the reading, which is true about St. Louse Steak House?
(A) It only opens at dinner time.
(B) It is a restaurant owned by Aaron.
(C) It is a quiet place to eat in all year round.
(D) They sell many kinds of cakes and pies there.

49. Which customer(s) of the four enjoyed the drinks in this restaurant?
(A) Only customer four.
(B) Customers one and three.
(C) Customers one and four.

chunk_text:
Mr. Chen played a video of a baby whale for us in class yesterday. In the video, the baby whale was lying on the beach. It was weak and dying, so people came to save it. They took it to the animal center and tried their best to save it. Sadly, the whale still lost its life after a week. What killed the whale? The whale’s stomach was full of plastic bags. The little poor animal just couldn’t tell food from trash, so it ate the plastic bags and then died.
The plastic problem is getting worse. People throw out tons of plastics each year. So the goal of 2024 Earth Day is to achieve a 60% reduction in the production of plastics by 2040 and gives a plastic‑free environment in the future. To save our earth, we should try not to use single‑use plastics, bring our bags when we go shopping, and recycle the plastics.
So let’s take actions to save all the sea animals and our earth.

chunk_text:
Twenty-three-year-old Jessii Vee from Ontario, Canada, turns her life into her work, 4 days a week. “I spend all of Sunday having ideas for videos to film that week,” says Jessii. “Then, on Monday, I get up early to start making the videos. Usually, it’s over an hour to make a video. I try to make about five, so it takes most of my day. Then, from Tuesday to Friday, I edit them.”

It also takes Jessii a few hours a week to write to her fans. Sometimes she meets fans when she goes out. Every time the fans recognize her, they want to take photos with her. However, online life isn’t all good. Jessii feels sad when people say something bad about her. She found a different way to think. “I can’t change myself to make everyone like me. I should believe in myself. Those people make mean comments online just because they don’t feel good about themselves.”

If you want to be a YouTuber, here are some advice from Jessii. First, safe is very important, so don’t show your face or real name and don’t tell people where you live. Second, be yourself. When you are not being the real you, you may look uneasy in videos, and that cannot catch people’s eye at all. Third, make videos about something you love or care. That way, you can always have fun filming. Last, it’s OK to turn off comments. Mean comments can make you unhappy and even sick. Nothing is more important than your health.

If you are planning on having a pleasant() meal with the whole family at a Sugar Factory for Thanksgiving,
you had better pick a different restaurant chain(). Cases() of the deadly stomach bug have reached three new
states, and it doesn’t look like they are going to stop anytime soon. This brings the count up from six states to nine.
The first cases were reported in the northern states of Devon and Grant at the end of October. So far 55 people have come
down with the bug(), and 52 of them said they had eaten at a Sugar Factory a week before they got sick. That was not
good news for the chain because it had to close 43 restaurants in those states() alone.
The Center for Public Health says that the bug first spread() south and then east. Now, seven more people in the
middle states have come down with the bug and are in the hospital fighting for their lives. If just one of them kicks the
bucket, that could mean the end of the line for the Sugar Factory.
(Nora Flanagan, Daily Post)

chunk_text:
No matter if you are shopping at a supermarket or at a clothing store, many of the prices ____ you see usually have something in common. They often end in .99, but isn’t it a little strange now that you think about it? Why aren’t prices just even numbers?
Many stores like to mark their prices to end in .99 for discounts, and customers almost never notice that ____ . Though no one really knows who or how the trick started, it has been around for at least a century. Ending a price in .99 is based on the theory that because we read from left to right, we usually only see the first number of the price. The price ____ starts with a 4 appears to be a better deal than the one that starts with 5. That’s why even though a product for $4.99 may be just one cent cheaper, the trick always helps sell more. ____ , the .99 alone allows people to believe that the item is on sale. Customers have become so used to it and think they are getting a good deal when they buy something with a price ending in .99.
The trick doesn’t only work for cents. In other studies about women’s clothes, a dress ____ price is changed from $34 to $39 is sold more by a third while changing it from $34 to $44 doesn’t have many different results. In these cases, the demand doesn’t go down ____ the prices are up. This proves that the number 9 has a surprising effect on customers. Now that you know the secrets behind pricing, look at them wisely when you go shopping next time.

chunk_text:
Do you sometimes feel someone is standing too close to you? Or maybe the person you're talking to keeps backing away, and you try to stay close by stepping closer to him or her? If so, it's probably because of different ideas about the personal space between you and the person you're talking to. According to one study, these ideas may have something to do with where you come from.
The study shows that people in different countries have different ideas about personal space. Romanians like to keep the greatest distance between themselves and someone they've just met. They usually keep a distance of 1.3 meters between themselves and others.
However, Argentinians stand the closest to other people, at a distance of only about 76 centimeters.
Another interesting thing was also found. People from hot and cold countries show the greatest differences in distance. This makes some people think that people in warmer places are friendlier. Whether that's true or not, one thing is for sure such differences could lead to misunderstanding. So, it's important to keep the right distance, or the person you're talking to might think you're invading his or her personal space. As a result, he or she might not feel comfortable around you.

30. Which of the following is the best title for this news?
(A) Less Is More
(B) Save the Best for the Last
(C) Don't Stand So Close
(D) You Only Live Once

31. According to the study, which of the following is NOT true?
(A) Romanians keep the longest distance when they talk with others.
(B) Argentinians stand the closest to people when they talk with others.
(C) People from cold countries stand closer to each other than those from warm countries.
(D) Ideas about personal space may have something to do with where people are from.

32. What does it mean to say that you are "invading" someone's personal space?
(A) It means that you are talking at a distance that makes others comfortable.
(B) It means that you are talking at a distance greater than 1.3 meters.
(C) It means that you are talking at a distance less than 76 centimeters.
(D) It means that you are standing at a distance that doesn't make others feel comfortable.

chunk_text:
Dear Green Connections,
I love Car Free Day, and I’d like to share how I celebrate it with you and your readers.
Car Free Day is a day that I take very seriously because it is very important not only for us people but also for our planet.
First, I must tell you that before I found out some facts about this special day, I drove my car everywhere. Sadly, I even drove to places that were less than five minutes away on foot. I now know that was bad of me. However, all that has changed. On Car Free Day and all the other days of the year, I ride my bike to the places I need to go.
At first, it was very difficult for me to get to places that were far away from my house because I was out of shape and got tired really easily. Then, over time, I got stronger and could travel to spots that were miles away.
Now, there isn’t a day that I don’t take my bike out somewhere nice in nature.
Biking has truly helped me see the world in a whole new way. What’s more, I can’t imagine going back to the life that wasn’t good for me or the environment.
All the best,
Derek

(A) To tell a bike company their products were made poorly.
(B) To tell people about a way of travel that doesn’t need gas.
(C) To explain a new way of travel that takes people out in nature quickly.
(D) To share a story that is all about cars with a group of readers.

chunk_text:
Do you get tired easily? Maybe the way you live has something to do with that. Check the following list of habits to see if they are the reasons for the problem and if you have any of them.
1. Everything has to be perfect, and you feel unhappy when it is not. You work really hard to reach this goal, but sometimes it is not what you are able to do. In the end, the only thing you get is wasted time.
2. Fast food is a big part of your everyday life. It is convenient to have fast food, but it is not healthy, and it makes your blood sugar higher. To bring that back down to a safe level, you need to change your eating habits, for example, get more fresh fruit and vegetables.
3. Your desk is always in a mess. Get things in order by cleaning up your desk, making it neat, and putting things that you don’t need in the drawers. Before leaving the office, get everything ready for the next morning.
4. You always go to bed late on weekends. If you stay up late on Saturday night and sleep late on Sunday morning, you will have problems getting to sleep on Sunday night. What you need to do is to get up at the same hour and take a short break in the afternoon.
5. You don’t exercise when you have free time. You need to get 30 minutes of exercise a day, five days a week. That will help you grow stronger.

36. What does “it” refer to?
(A) Making profits.
(B) Working hard.
(C) Being perfect.
(D) Feeling unhappy.

How many items on the list does Allen most likely to make a check?

chunk_text:
You are on a plane and ready to take your first bite of airplane food, but it doesn’t taste as good as it does on land. So, why do food and drinks on airplanes taste different?
In fact, we tell flavors through our senses of smell and taste. Sadly, those two senses become less strong when we fly 30,000 feet above the Earth. The humidity level in the air is only 12%, and the air pressure is really low. As a result, our noses don’t work so well. When our noses don’t work well, our sense of taste doesn’t, either. That is because 80% of our sense of taste comes from our sense of smell. Therefore, salty and sweet flavors go down by about 30%. Besides, the loud noise from the plane makes the problem even worse. Luckily, we can still taste bitter, sour, and spicy flavors.
Now, you know what changes the taste of food and drinks on airplanes. So, next time you are on a plane and taste something bad, the problem may not be with the cooks.

22. What are the airlines most likely doing to make their food taste better?
(A) Using sugar as little as possible.
(B) Adding more salt to their dishes.
(C) Cooking with a lot of chili pepper.
(D) Putting twice vinegar in the food.

23. According to the reading, which does NOT make airplane food taste bad?
(A) The dry air.
(B) The low air pressure.
(C) The loud noise from the plane.
(D) The cooks on the plane.

24. Which chart shows the changes when we fly?
(A) (B)
(C) (D)

chunk_text:
Leon: Irene, what are you doing?
Irene: Hi, Leon. I’m checking my friends’ Instagram.
Leon: Again? You really spend too much time on it.
Irene: Maybe you’re right. But I just can’t help looking at everyone’s Instagram. Most of the time, I check others’ Instagram because they look happy but I am not. I want to know why.
Leon: Have you ever heard of “social media depression”?
Irene: No, what is that?
Leon: Some studies say social media has something to do with depression. It’s easy for social media users to compare themselves with their friends. However, whether they are better or worse than their friends, they always feel worse about themselves in the end.
Irene: I agree. Every time I check my friends’ Instagram, I feel sad. It seems that they have better lives than I do.
Leon: Hey! You should read this study. It says, “Instagram, out of other social media, is most likely to make young people feel depressed.”
Irene: Really? Why is that?
Leon: I don’t know, but I do know one thing—Online communication is very different from face-to-face communication. What you see on social media is not always true.

25. According to the study in the dialogue, which is true?
(A) You will feel happier if you find out you are better than others.
(B) The more we use social media, the less happy we seem to be.
(C) Through social media, you can know others’ lives well.
(D) Instagram is great because it helps us share our lives with our friends.

Laura Metcalfe, a call handler of 999 in England, got a call from a four-year-old girl.
Laura: Hello, 28. 999. How may I help you?
Mila: It’s Mila. Mama needs help. Please. (Mila cries.)
Laura: Don’t cry, dear. What’s going on? Is your Mama OK? Where’s she?
Mila: She fell when she was going up the stairs.
Laura: May I talk to her now?
Mila: No, you can’t. She’s sleeping.
Laura: She’s sleeping? Can you wake her up?
Mila: No, I can’t.
Laura: Why not? 29.
Mila: Oh, her head is bleeding. (Mila cried again.)
Laura: Listen, Mila. We want to help your mama. Tell me your telephone number now. I’ll ask the police to go over to your house.
After Laura 30. Mila, she called the police. And the police went to Mila’s house right away.
Because of Mila’s phone call, 31. . Mila’s mother is getting better now. She thinks her daughter is very smart. “I’m happy. Mama’s better now. I love my mama,” Mila said.

chunk_text:
God: Because you did a lot of good things, I will give you three wishes. What do you want?
Man: I want to be a basketball player.
God: No problem.
(Ten minutes later)
Man: Oh, my God!!!
God: Did you call me?
Man: Why am I so squat?
God: You wanted to be a basketball player, but you didn’t say a tall one.
Man: Fine. My second wish is to be a rich man.
God: OK. Tomorrow when you wake up, you will be.
(the next day)
Man: God!!!
God: Yes?
Man: I can’t move! What happened?
God: You wanted to be a rich man, but you didn’t ask to be a healthy one.
Man: Oh, God.
God: Do you want to make the third wish?
Man: …Just change me back.
God: Are you serious?
Man: Yes. Although I was not rich and could not play basketball, I could still walk.
I guess I wasn’t that bad. I don’t want to be another person.
God: You finally see the point. Have a wonderful life.

________ 32. What does “squat” mean?
(A) healthy (B) short (C) rich (D) sick

Man: Fine. My second wish is to be a rich man.
God: OK. Tomorrow when you wake up, you will be.
(the next day)
Man: God!!!
God: Yes?
Man: I can’t move! What happened?
God: You wanted to be a rich man, but you didn’t ask to be a healthy one.
Man: Oh, God.
God: Do you want to make the third wish?
Man: …Just change me back.
God: Are you serious?
Man: Yes. Although I was not rich and could not play basketball, I could still walk.
I guess I wasn’t that bad. I don’t want to be another person.
God: You finally see the point. Have a wonderful life.

chunk_text:
Taylor Swift is an American singer. She showed her music talent at very young age. When she was 14, she sang in front of thousands of people. She is a singer, a songwriter, a director, a producer and a businesswoman. She received a lot of awards for her music. Five of her songs, including “Shake It Off” (2014), “Blank Space” (2014), and “Look What You Made Me Do” (2017), topped the Billboard Hot 100. Swift is a very popular with people around the world. Taylor Swift started The Eras Tour from March, 2023. It’s her biggest tour yet. Each show has 44 songs and lasts over three hours. The Eras Tour will last to December, 2024. Her fans all over the world can’t wait to go to her concert and have fun there.

45. What might Taylor Swift be according to the reading?
(A) A farmer. (B) A businesswoman. (C) A housewife. (D) A doctor.
46. What is The Eras Tour?
(A) Movies. (B) Trips. (C) Pictures. (D) Shows.
47. How long will be The Eras Tour?
(A) 2 years. (B) 10 months. (C) 22 months. (D) One and a half years.
source: ./pdf/市立大灣國中 八年級 112 上學期 語文領域 英文 第三次段考 期末考 康軒 試卷.pdf

grammar_points: 可數名詞與不可數名詞
過去簡單式（規則 / 不規則）
副詞（方式 / 地點 / 時間 / 頻率）
chunk_text:
There is a special woman from Pakistan, and her name is Malala Yousafzai. In her childhood, she loved school and always enjoyed her classes. At that same time in Pakistan, there was a group of people, the Taliban. They didn’t care about women’s education. Women should be cooking at home and having babies. “They shouldn’t go to school,” the Taliban said. They then stopped women from going to school ever again.

Malala didn’t like this, so she did something about it. She wrote about her life and women’s troubles in Pakistan. She told the world her story, and the world listened. The Taliban was very angry. They shot her, but she didn’t die. Two years later, she won the Nobel Peace Prize. What an amazing woman!

48. What did the Taliban say about women?
(A) They should go to school. (B) They should do the housework for their family.
(C) They should tell their stories to the world. (D) They should write something about their life.
49. What do we know about Malala?
(A) She joined the Taliban. (B) The Taliban shot her school.
(C) She didn’t like to study. (D) She tried to tell her story and women’s troubles to the world.
50. What is this reading mainly about?
(A) Malala fought for women’s education. (B) Women should be at home.
(C) The Taliban killed many people. (D) A girl loved school very much.
source: ./pdf/市立大灣國中 八年級 112 上學期 語文領域 英文 第三次段考 期末考 康軒 試卷.pdf
